1 'use strict';
  2 
  3 var _ = require('underscore');
  4 
  5 /*global _: false*/
  6 module.exports = function(AV) {
  7   /**
  8    * Routers map faux-URLs to actions, and fire events when routes are
  9    * matched. Creating a new one sets its `routes` hash, if not set statically.
 10    * @class
 11    *
 12    * <p>A fork of Backbone.Router, provided for your convenience.
 13    * For more information, see the
 14    * <a href="http://documentcloud.github.com/backbone/#Router">Backbone
 15    * documentation</a>.</p>
 16    * <p><strong><em>Available in the client SDK only.</em></strong></p>
 17    */
 18   AV.Router = function(options) {
 19     console.warn("AV.Router is deprecated, please don't use it anymore.");
 20     options = options || {};
 21     if (options.routes) {
 22       this.routes = options.routes;
 23     }
 24     this._bindRoutes();
 25     this.initialize.apply(this, arguments);
 26   };
 27 
 28   // Cached regular expressions for matching named param parts and splatted
 29   // parts of route strings.
 30   var namedParam    = /:\w+/g;
 31   var splatParam    = /\*\w+/g;
 32   var escapeRegExp  = /[\-\[\]{}()+?.,\\\^\$\|#\s]/g;
 33 
 34   // Set up all inheritable **AV.Router** properties and methods.
 35   _.extend(AV.Router.prototype, AV.Events,
 36            /** @lends AV.Router.prototype */ {
 37 
 38     /**
 39      * Initialize is an empty function by default. Override it with your own
 40      * initialization logic.
 41      */
 42     initialize: function(){},
 43 
 44     /**
 45      * Manually bind a single named route to a callback. For example:
 46      *
 47      * <pre>this.route('search/:query/p:num', 'search', function(query, num) {
 48      *       ...
 49      *     });</pre>
 50      */
 51     route: function(route, name, callback) {
 52       AV.history = AV.history || new AV.History();
 53       if (!_.isRegExp(route)) {
 54         route = this._routeToRegExp(route);
 55       }
 56       if (!callback) {
 57         callback = this[name];
 58       }
 59       AV.history.route(route, _.bind(function(fragment) {
 60         var args = this._extractParameters(route, fragment);
 61         if (callback) {
 62           callback.apply(this, args);
 63         }
 64         this.trigger.apply(this, ['route:' + name].concat(args));
 65         AV.history.trigger('route', this, name, args);
 66       }, this));
 67       return this;
 68     },
 69 
 70     /**
 71      * Whenever you reach a point in your application that you'd
 72      * like to save as a URL, call navigate in order to update the
 73      * URL. If you wish to also call the route function, set the
 74      * trigger option to true. To update the URL without creating
 75      * an entry in the browser's history, set the replace option
 76      * to true.
 77      */
 78     navigate: function(fragment, options) {
 79       AV.history.navigate(fragment, options);
 80     },
 81 
 82     // Bind all defined routes to `AV.history`. We have to reverse the
 83     // order of the routes here to support behavior where the most general
 84     // routes can be defined at the bottom of the route map.
 85     _bindRoutes: function() {
 86       if (!this.routes) {
 87         return;
 88       }
 89       var routes = [];
 90       for (var route in this.routes) {
 91         if (this.routes.hasOwnProperty(route)) {
 92           routes.unshift([route, this.routes[route]]);
 93         }
 94       }
 95       for (var i = 0, l = routes.length; i < l; i++) {
 96         this.route(routes[i][0], routes[i][1], this[routes[i][1]]);
 97       }
 98     },
 99 
100     // Convert a route string into a regular expression, suitable for matching
101     // against the current location hash.
102     _routeToRegExp: function(route) {
103       route = route.replace(escapeRegExp, '\\$&')
104                    .replace(namedParam, '([^\/]+)')
105                    .replace(splatParam, '(.*?)');
106       return new RegExp('^' + route + '$');
107     },
108 
109     // Given a route, and a URL fragment that it matches, return the array of
110     // extracted parameters.
111     _extractParameters: function(route, fragment) {
112       return route.exec(fragment).slice(1);
113     }
114   });
115 
116   /**
117    * @function
118    * @param {Object} instanceProps Instance properties for the router.
119    * @param {Object} classProps Class properies for the router.
120    * @return {Class} A new subclass of <code>AV.Router</code>.
121    */
122   AV.Router.extend = AV._extend;
123 };
124
